results.definition: difficult to handle; requiring great tact
examples: delicate negotiations with the big powers

results.definition: easily broken or damaged or destroyed
examples: a kite too delicate to fly safely

results.definition: developed with extreme delicacy and subtlety
exquisitely fine and subtle and pleasing; susceptible to injury
examples: the delicate wing of a butterfly

results.definition: marked by great skill especially in meticulous technique
of an instrument or device; capable of registering minute differences or changes precisely
examples: almost undetectable with even the most delicate instruments
